column5: Decided to head out on Lake O yesterday evening to see if we could get a few staggers to go.    The winds finally changed to the north so I was hoping the warm water would finally be pushed off the shore line.  Plan was to go out for a few hours before dark and mess around with the riggers and dipsys then come in close once it got dark and cast.    Started in 50FOW with a blank screen, wasted 10 mins doing that until we pulled up and headed a bit deeper.   80ft seemed to be the ticket as I was marking fish hugging bottom.  Figuring they were lakers I decided what the hell lets at least move some rods.   Ran SD + flies + Nasty boys on the dipsys and a JPlug and a Nasty boy off the riggers.   Figured out real soon these weren't lakers but chinooks.  80ft down over 85-100ft was the ticket.   Tally for the night was 8 chinook and one beauty Coho.  Most of the action came off the deep stuff, but we did get the coho on the SD+fly and another chinny off the dipsys once it started to get dark.   Once it got dark I pulled up and got ready for casting.   Water was way to warm, wasted 2hrs casting and packed it in.   Need a few days of strong N winds to get rid of that warm water then it should be on.    Kept a shaker for a friend, the rest are back swimming.     I let her do all the reeling, she complained about sore arms
Nice! just tell her you did the hardest part, finding them, the reeling part is less work!
I didn't wanna overwhelm her too much, lol!
Lucky you got out before the weekend? The forecast here doesn't look good for late Saturday thru Monday, 40 mile an hour winds and up to 7 inches of rain.
Weekend isn't too bad up here, looks like Monday isn't going to be very nice though.
nice going. Its been one of those years on our side  - where you gotta go with your gut to connect, great way to spend an evening
Be careful Bill. Shes gonna end up beating all your PB.

Yeah it was nice to pattern them out fairly quickly.   Funny thing is there was a spot that just produced fish after fish, every time I circled back and trolled through a rod went off.   I should have vertical jigged them just for the fun of it, lol.
Nicely done! That's exciting fishing, I'm sure your better half had a blast. It looks like some rain is coming and some of those fish might be on the move.
Yeah I hope so, I'd like her to get a few while casting at night.  That's a riot.
nice going.  i have inly been out three times all season need to get out at least once more.
